content.div:
Harley Pasternak has come a long way since his time as a University of Toronto student studying exercise physiology and nutritional sciences. These days, the fitness guru, New York Times bestselling author and star of ABC's daytime talk show The Revolution is focused on promoting fitness, whether that means tackling the nation's obesity problem or spending time on the road with Kanye West and Katy Perry.

"With Kanye West, in one month we hit fourteen countries, where we literally did a new country every day or every other day," the soft-spoken Pasternak recalls during a recent press day in Toronto. "You definitely can't have the same boundaries and limitations (in your fitness regime)."

Pasternak – who developed the popular "5-Factor" diet, which consists of a series of five-ingredient meals, eaten five times a day in conjunction with a series of five-minute workouts – began his celebrity personal training business during those studious days at UofT, working with actors who were shooting in Toronto before eventually expanding his clientele to "over 150 celebrities, 75 feature film (sets) and 30 concert tours."

On the day we speak, one of his former clients, Lady Gaga, admitted publicly that she struggled with bulimia in high school.

"Eating disorders are so prevalent with (celebrities) and I think her coming out is so brave," he says.

But despite his client roster frequently popping up in supermarket tabloids, the Los Angeles-based Pasternak is quick to point out that his job description does not include being a psychologist to the stars.

"I think it started off being like that, but (I'm with) these people, for five, ten minutes a day and they appreciate you being as professional as possible."

It's that mentality of respect and professionalism that led Pasternak to two of his most important life decisions to date: turning down extreme fitness show The Biggest Loser and, years later, choosing to become part of The Revolution.

"[Biggest Loser co-creator] J.D. Roth came to me and said, 'I'm starting a show called The Biggest Loser and I want you to be the trainer, to be the guy,'" he recalls. "It sounded interesting but just before we started shooting the show I decided that it wasn't the right fit for me. It didn't fit with my messaging; I'm not about getting people to lose weight as quickly as possible by any means necessary and taking them away from their family and their job and putting them on a fat farm and screaming and yelling at them. It wasn't me. Of course, the show turned out to be a ginormous success.

"Many years later he came back to me and said, 'I respect you for not doing The Biggest Loser because that wasn't you. I'm developing a show where I'm taking the absolute authorities in five fields and we are going to revolutionize a woman's life every week and we won't take her out of her life,' and I said, 'Bingo!'"

Co-hosted by Project Runway's Tim Gunn, Extreme Makeover: Home Edition designer Ty Pennington, doctor Jennifer Ashton, and life coach Tiffanie Davis, The Revolution gels with Pasternak's philosophy. In contrast to the other popular one-doctor-fits-all daytime shows, The Revolution ensures that each host sticks to their field of expertise to produce the best results.

"Dr. Phil, for some reason, because he's a doctor -- and I don't even know what he's a doctor of -- he's an authority on everything from relationships to medical health to weight loss to healthy eating; he's an absolute authority on everything." Pasternak says. "On our show we do have authorities and we are only authorities in what we do.

"For example, my role on the show is not to be involved in their personal lives."

Of course, sometimes it simply can't be avoided, like when the hosts discussed Gunn's on-air admission that he hadn't had sex in nearly three decades.

"We talked about it off camera before when we were doing some test shows earlier on so I did know about that," Pasternak admits with embarrassment. "I didn't know he would be so bold as to go on television and tell people about it."

jond@dose.ca

link.Abstract: All you want for Christmas is pictures of pop stars? Done and done. Check out photos of Lady Gaga, David Guetta, Big Time Rush and more at Jingle Ball. The event took place at L.A. Live's Nokia Theatre on December 3, 2011.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga and More at L.A.'s Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: What was the worst day of Lady Gaga's life? Her new video holds the answer.
link.title: Video: Lady Gaga, 'Marry the Night'

link.Abstract: A free iPad offer posted on Lady Gaga's Twitter and Facebook pages was (obviously) the work of hackers.
link.title: Sorry, Lady Gaga Isn't Going to Buy You an iPad

link.Abstract: Jennifer Lopez and Rebecca Black topped YouTube's year-in-review lists for the most-watched videos of the year.
link.title: Jennifer Lopez, Rebecca Black Have Most Viewed YouTube Clips of 2011

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga was the headliner at Jingle Ball, Dec. 9 in New York City. But the event featured more pop stars than you can fit under a Christmas tree. Check out pics of Kelly Clarkson, LMFAO, Demi Lovato, Hot Chelle Rae, Pitbull, Foster the People, David Guetta and more, performing at Madison Square Garden.
link.title: Photos: Kelly Clarkson, Lady Gaga, LMFAO and More Play New York's Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: During Lady Gaga's Thanksgiving TV special, the pop star revealed she once posed for Tony Bennett in the nude. Clearly, we don't know enough about American Thanksgiving traditions.
link.title: Lady Gaga Says She Posed in the Nude For Tony Bennett; Happy American Thanksgiving!

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga made out with Sting, did pilates on a motorcycle/keyboard and danced in her underwear. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Gaga's Sept. 24 set at the I Heart Radio music festival.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga Plays I Heart Radio Fest

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga vows to channel her inner "Indian hippie" at a press conference in New Delhi.
link.title: Gallery: Lady Gaga in India

link.title: Kanye West

link.Abstract: Where's the beef? Australia, apparently. Kanye West's soundcheck at the Big Day Out festival was so loud it reportedly drowned out Soundgarden's set, leading Soundgarden's Chris Cornell to make one very public noise complaint.
link.title: Photos: Kanye West, Soundgarden and More at Australia's Big Day Out

link.Abstract: Jay-Z and Kanye West wrapped their Watch the Throne tour in Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18. For the final concert's closing number, they performed the single "N*ggas in Paris" 11 times. Crazy. In that spirit, here are 11 of the best photos from Vancouver. We invite you to spend approx. 40 minutes flipping through them.
link.title: The 11 Best Photos From Watch the Throne's Final Show

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal

link.Abstract: Those aren't her eyes, 'Ye. Kanye West, Jay-Z and Nicki Minaj performed at the 2011 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show, airing Nov. 29 on CBS. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Kanye West, Jay-Z and Nicki Minaj at the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show

link.Abstract: Kanye West and a who's who including Jay-Z and Kid Cudi landed at the South By Southwest Festival March 19 for VEVO Presents: G.O.O.D. Music. Some 3,000 people reportedly packed into the city's former power plant for the show -- and we've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Kanye West, Jay-Z Rock SXSW

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West, Adele Lead Grammy Nominations

link.Abstract: Kanye West returned to Twitter Wednesday, suggesting he'll release an album on his G.O.O.D. Music imprint in Spring 2012.
link.title: Kanye West Announces G.O.O.D. Music Album (More Important: He's Tweeting Again!)

link.Abstract: Kanye West and Jay-Z's first Watch the Throne music video is here. Watch "Otis," directed by Spike Jonze.
link.title: Watch Kanye West and Jay-Z (And Aziz Ansari?) Chop Up a Maybach In 'Otis'

link.Abstract: Listen up! We've got reviews of new music from Jay-Z and Kanye West, Nick Carter, The Deep Dark Woods, Fountains of Wayne and The Horrors.
link.title: Album Reviews (Jay-Z and Kanye West, Nick Carter, The Horrors and More)

link.Abstract: The Black Keys, Radiohead and Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg will headline the 2012 Coachella festival, which will run as back-to-back weekend events April 13-15 and April 20-22. The full line-up was announced Monday.
link.title: The 2012 Coachella Line-up Is Here; The Black Keys, Radiohead, Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg to Headline Back-to-Back Weekends

link.Abstract: Using West's tweets and what appears to be stock footage, Kimmel's team made a fake commercial for the rapper's new DONDA design company.
link.title: Watch Jimmy Kimmel's Fake Commercial for Kanye West's DONDA

link.Abstract: For all those who worried Steve Jobs' death signaled the end of American innovation, fear not, Kanye West has got you covered.
link.title: Kanye West Uses Three-Hour Twitter Rant to Declare Himself Next "Steve Jobs"

link.Abstract: From Madge to Minaj, these are the albums Dose.ca is looking forward to in early 2012.
link.title: Spring 2012 Music Preview
